Class SentimentDictionary

java.lang.Object
  SentimentDictionary

public class SentimentDictionary
extends java.lang.Object

This class is a singleton that manages access to the sentiments dictionary. The sentiments file is part of the Twitter Trends project by Aditi Muralidharan, John DeNero, and Hamilton Nguyen and featured on Stanfordâ€™s Nifty Lab's site.

Version:
08jul2016

gcschmit

Constructor Detail

SentimentDictionary

private SentimentDictionary()
Default Constructor for objects of class SentimentDictionary. This is private to ensure that the getSingleton method is used by clients.

SentimentDictionary

private SentimentDictionary(java.lang.String fileName)
Constructor for objects of class SentimentDictionary. This is private to ensure that the getSingleton method is used by clients.

Parameters:
fileName - name of the sentiments file from which to build this dictionary
Method Detail

getSentiment

public java.lang.Double getSentiment(java.lang.String word)
Returns the sentiment associated with the specified word. The sentiment will range from -1 to 1, where negative values correspond to negative sentiment; positive values, positive. If there is no sentiment for the specified word, a null value will be returned.

Parameters:
word - the word whose sentiment will be returned, the word must be all lowercase
Returns:
the sentiment associated with the specified word or null if none

getSingleton

public static SentimentDictionary getSingleton()
Returns the singleton instance of the SentimentDictionary. Clients should invoke this method to obtain a refernece to a SentimentDictionary object.

Returns:
the singleton instance of the SentimentDictionary
